meanings.definition: Sloping surface or side of a mountain or hill.
meanings.sent1: The hikers carefully climbed the steep versant of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The goats effortlessly navigated the rocky versant to reach the grassy meadow.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel decided to ski down the snowy versant for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as unyielding as the unrelenting versant she was scaling.
meanings.sent5: The sunlit versant glowed like a golden ribbon against the green landscape.

meanings.definition: Someone who is knowledgeable or skilled in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: As a versant in computer programming, he was sought after by many tech companies.
meanings.sent2: The professor was a versant in ancient history, captivating his students with his lectures.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed to be a versant in the art of disappearing acts.
meanings.sent4: She was a versant in the language of flowers, able to decipher their hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: His reputation as a versant in culinary arts spread far and wide.
